content: Call 911 and get billed $911.00 User fees and they still have to pay state and local taxes. Yippee it's a matter of time before we all get it. "After her sport utility vehicle sideswiped a van in early February, Shirley Kimel was amazed at how quickly a handful of police officers and firefighters in Winter Haven, Fla., showed up. But a real shock came a week later, when a letter arrived from the city billing her $316 for the cost of responding to the accident. " "http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/30162245/"
reply: Call 911 and get billed $911.00 User fees and they still have to pay state and local taxes. Yippee it's a matter of time before we all get it. content: Remember "fees" and the like are NOT deductable, but a tax is. So the Gvt. screws you twice, ONCE in charging a fee for something they ALREADY collect a tax from you for, and THEN making the fee part of your taxable income! How perfect is THAT?
reply: Remember "fees" and the like are NOT deductable, but a tax is. So the Gvt. screws you twice, ONCE in charging a fee for something they ALREADY collect a tax from you for, and THEN making the fee part of your taxable income! How perfect is THAT?
title: Cities, states turn to fees to fill budget gaps

content: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: quote: Originally posted by EspritDeCorps: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Call 911 and get billed $911.00 User fees and they still have to pay state and local taxes. Yippee it's a matter of time before we all get it. "After her sport utility vehicle sideswiped a van in early February, Shirley Kimel was amazed at how quickly a handful of police officers and firefighters in Winter Haven, Fla., showed up. But a real shock came a week later, when a letter arrived from the city billing her $316 for the cost of responding to the accident. " "http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/30162245/" Ya mean we will have to PAY for services! THAT'S UNCONSTITUTIONAL! Don't you think that you are already paying for your services by paying your local and state taxes? Local taxes usually through sales taxes (depressed when people stop buying extraneous stuff) and property taxes (depressed when home/land values drop). States get a significant amount from income taxes, which get depressed when people become unemployed or have to take lower paying jobs. "user fees" and "sin taxes" are going to become a fact of life. They are easy to implement, and once a fee or tax is started or increased, it hardly ever goes away.
quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: quote: Originally posted by EspritDeCorps: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Call 911 and get billed $911.00 User fees and they still have to pay state and local taxes. " "http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/30162245/" Ya mean we will have to PAY for services! THAT'S UNCONSTITUTIONAL! Don't you think that you are already paying for your services by paying your local and state taxes?
reply: Local taxes usually through sales taxes (depressed when people stop buying extraneous stuff) and property taxes (depressed when home/land values drop). States get a significant amount from income taxes, which get depressed when people become unemployed or have to take lower paying jobs. "user fees" and "sin taxes" are going to become a fact of life. They are easy to implement, and once a fee or tax is started or increased, it hardly ever goes away.
title: Cities, states turn to fees to fill budget gaps

content: Remember "quotas"? They'll be back. Gov't will make up shortfalls anyway they can...that means new and improved "out of the box" thinking on taxes, etc. I suppose we'll have to live with it...as long as we see some value in return. Juries still out on that one...we'll see...in due time...
reply: Remember "quotas"? They'll be back. Gov't will make up shortfalls anyway they can...that means new and improved "out of the box" thinking on taxes, etc. I suppose we'll have to live with it...as long as we see some value in return. Juries still out on that one...we'll see...in due time...

content: I'm already driving very carefully. Cops are pulling people over and giving them frivilous tickets just to ensure they get a paycheck... Its a fact of life...Police get their paycheck from city, city gets revenue from tickets...
